TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 5/9/2018 at 5:37 PM, beomagi said:
> 
> 
> Thanks Booly ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") Decided to roll another craft, trying to push the <abbr title="Delta-V">DV</abbr> higher.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> This space plane has nearly 6000dv after getting to <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>. So I visit every station I've made in Kerbin's influence with a dock.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I dock with 5 stations and land on minmus without refueling. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Images resized to 500px wide to keep it easier on DL - or just use link below.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [https://imgur.com/gallery/YGaB6BS](https://imgur.com/gallery/YGaB6BS)
> 

Very cool mission! A suggestion, it would be easier for everyone if you put the images in a "spoiler" tag so that people don't have to scroll so much to go through the forum.
Thanks. Updated the post.

[@beomagi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/168393-beomagi/) in spirit  I believe your mission is a K-Prize winner. Though there is one point of technical difficulty with it which perhaps you could clarify. Where did the fuel come from to move the "base mun" station plus SP 6000 (is that the right name?) around Minmus into a higher orbit? 

If the fuel came from SP 6000 then it is an interesting precedent, using it as a fuel supply boat. If it came from the space station then it technically ought to break the docking rule but it is not covered by existing rules. However I am minded to overlook it on this occasion because the SP 6000 went on to land on Minmus which was the opposite direction to the assist, so it actually cost <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr> and did not add towards a kudos achievement. However I will need to devise a rule to exclude docking to boosters because in order to compare craft capabilities they must proceed using their own thrust and fuel, which is the same reason the K-Prize is stock only. 

**Edited <time datetime="2018-05-19T14:40:51Z" title="05/19/2018 02:40  PM" data-short="6 yr">May 19, 2018</time> by boolybooly**

> 
> 
> 50 minutes ago, boolybooly said:
> 
> 
> [@beomagi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/168393-beomagi/) in spirit  I believe your mission is a K-Prize winner. Though there is one point of technical difficulty with it which perhaps you could clarify. Where did the fuel come from to move the "base mun" station plus SP 6000 (is that the right name?) around Minmus into a higher orbit?
> 

Hmm A bit of both I believe. I hadn't paid it much notice.  ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif ":(")

Looking at the before and after docking, the <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr> dopped by 42. While I am using main thrusters for docking, 42 is a lot for that. I generally use 0.5-1.5m/s when docking. Assuming multiple tries, say 15-20dv ? The station orbit change of ~5k average to ~12k was maybe 10-20 <abbr title="Delta-V">dv</abbr>.

Running the station thrusters looks like it pulled fuel from both. I haven't changed crossfeed settings.

Thanks for clarifying [@beomagi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/168393-beomagi/) , as I said I think at a practical level the mission is a K-Prize winner (and I need to work on the rules), so thanks for your detailed report of an extensive mission and congratulations for ...

- Astrokerbal Distinction (Minmus), Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with [SP-6000](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3374956).

and welcome back to the K-Prize party guest list aka the role of honour. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") (FYI the Astrokerbal Distinction includes the Kosmokerbal Commendations for visiting SOIs since you have to visit an <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI</abbr> to land on another planet/oid.)

I built a bunch of SSTOs a couple years ago and discovered that it's REALLY hard to actually get them to orbit and back. I figured I'd give it a shot again. And it worked!

Spoiler

![pvNkWMW.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/pvNkWMW.jpg)

I used a modification of my ship, the Mk2 <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> Quad. I've uploaded it to KerbalX: [https://kerbalx.com/LevAerospace/Mk2-<abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>-Quad-A](https://kerbalx.com/LevAerospace/Mk2-SSTO-Quad-A) 

Spoiler

![ATxIKsq.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/ATxIKsq.jpg)

I made it to orbit with a little fuel left, which was great because I would've landed in the mountains otherwise. The great thing about this plane is that it's very stable. I glides very well, too, which is very helpful when landing. Not great for high speed, though. It was a chore getting it out of the atmosphere.

My Kerbals looked very proud afterwards. Good thing they don't know about their alternate universe selves who died horribly over and over again.

Spoiler

![E28Soq5.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/E28Soq5.jpg)

I'm going to keep going with it - maybe earn one of the more advanced distinctions!

Jamie

Thanks for your mission report [@doggonemess](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/160106-doggonemess/) , you are right, spaceplanes are hard but that is why we do these things. Congratulations on completing the K-Prize mission successfully and returning to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway safely, which merits kudos ... 

... Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Mk2 <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> Quad.

Welcome to the role of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list. If you would like to report more advanced missions they will be very welcome. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

**Edited <time datetime="2018-06-06T01:08:13Z" title="06/06/2018 01:08  AM" data-short="6 yr">June 6, 2018</time> by mrhexed**

Thanks for your comprehensive video report of your <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> mission to Minmus [@mrhexed](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/181261-mrhexed/). Recovering from the reentry spin encurred by the exploding air brakes showed skillful piloting, nevertheless the explosion itself unfortunately broke K-Prize rules, see rule 1 about not losing parts since exploding parts are considered lost. 

This qualifies the report for a gatecrasher link on the front page, on the list of gatecrashing infamy, plus quip and the right to display the gatecrasher logo. Which is quite a good deal.

However if you would prefer you also have the right to have the gatecrasher listing expunged (or kept, your call) if you complete a successful K-Prize mission. The choice is yours and I will hold off on listing the gatecrasher for a bit in case you decide you want to complete the mission. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

ok, thanks for telling me! I'll get back to work on making an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> to orbit

**Kerbal Design Bureau's KDB-<abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>-1!** 

**"Kerbin's most polite <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>"**

Jeb didn't want to walk from the end of the runway all the way to the astronaut complex, so he decided to use the KDB-<abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>-I. Being Jeb, he decided to take a little detour. An orbital detour!

\*NOTE: This <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> made a 75x91 orbit, but due to Jeb being needed to ~~terrorize~~ motivate the interns,  the retro-burn occurred before a full orbit was completed. Had the interns not accidentally set fire to their own heads testing a new rocket motor, Jeb would've been able to spend more time in space. 

Images:

Spoiler

![wbGiIWh.png](https://i.imgur.com/wbGiIWh.png)

The <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>-I on the runway

![mwHYdv8.png](https://imgur.com/mwHYdv8.png)

Final ascent, only about 30 seconds left until the closed-cycle engine kicks in

![vvequgk.png](https://imgur.com/vvequgk.png)  

Retro-burn

![QSbfVAk.png](https://imgur.com/QSbfVAk.png)

Re-entry interface beauty shot. "That's no Mun!" 

![ugXj6RI.png](https://imgur.com/ugXj6RI.png)

Final descent

![5CTy4j3.png](https://imgur.com/5CTy4j3.png)

I *really* suck at judging glide slopes

![DwxphiJ.png](https://imgur.com/DwxphiJ.png)

Flare...

![TBKpe6D.png](https://imgur.com/TBKpe6D.png)

...aaannddd touchdown!

1

**Edited <time datetime="2018-06-14T02:09:30Z" title="06/14/2018 02:09  AM" data-short="6 yr">June 14, 2018</time> by Kerbal Design Bureau**
  
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

First post of a new account! Here's my submission:

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/APOxoeApVtg?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

Very very basic but hey, gotta start somewhere.

Hello, this my attempt to the K-prize

I present you : 

**Cheval mk4-3 (50t.)**

I stuffed a little Mun land base with a Mem style exploration module, the whole payload wheighing 31t.

[![z0qdlr.jpg](https://sm2.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/z0qdlr.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=z0qdlr.jpg&photoId=1246401)

The ascent was a bit sketchy because I added thermal panels after building the fairing and did noticed them poking through, which I think added quite some drag.. ~~  Strangely they did not explode on the Mun.

Spoiler

[![5db5j0.jpg](https://sm2.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/5db5j0.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=5db5j0.jpg&photoId=1246402)

Here the craft is orbiting at around 75x75

Spoiler

[![e21qbg.jpg](https://sm2.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/e21qbg.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=e21qbg.jpg&photoId=1246403)

Arrival around the Mun

Spoiler

[![qoucw9.jpg](https://sm3.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/qoucw9.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=qoucw9.jpg&photoId=1246404)

[![23gr2r.jpg](https://sm2.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/23gr2r.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=23gr2r.jpg&photoId=1246375)

Deployement of the base

Spoiler

[![ygk03k.jpg](https://sm3.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/ygk03k.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=ygk03k.jpg&photoId=1246405)

[![pjc2r5.jpg](https://sm3.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/pjc2r5.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=pjc2r5.jpg&photoId=1246406)

I know the solar panels are occulting each other but I thought it'd look cool anyway ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

Time to return home !

Spoiler

[![80utu0.jpg](https://sm3.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/80utu0.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=80utu0.jpg&photoId=1246407)

First aerobraking

Spoiler

[![b09wcp.jpg](https://sm3.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/b09wcp.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=b09wcp.jpg&photoId=1246413)

I thought I'd dive in Kerbin's atmosphere whilst coming down from the Mun at 45km high but I only managed to approach my <abbr title="Apoapsis">Ap</abbr>, so I set a rendez-vous with my Skylab attempt. At this point I had 350m/s left, 0.3° correction to make and only a 110m/s of retro-burn on target.

Spoiler

[![144git.jpg](https://sm2.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/144git.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=144git.jpg&photoId=1246418)

Should have put a Sr. dock on that ship... !

Second re-entry

Spoiler

[![mmh0ma.jpg](https://sm2.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/mmh0ma.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=mmh0ma.jpg&photoId=1246427)

Approach

Spoiler

[![mpj9bc.jpg](https://sm2.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/mpj9bc.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=mpj9bc.jpg&photoId=1246430)

And final landing !

It was quite tricky because the plane was very sensitive at more than 300m/s, the <abbr title="Center of Lift">CoL</abbr> being into the <abbr title="Center of Mass">CoM</abbr> when empty..

Spoiler

[![wxlxt9.jpg](https://sm2.photorapide.com/membres/1144/photos/wxlxt9.jpg)](https://www.photorapide.com/images.php?photoName=wxlxt9.jpg&photoId=1246435)
[@Kerbolitto](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/189092-kerbolitto/) love the atypical design!   ...good mission, well done!

Thanks a lot ! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") I tried really hard to get a proper twin boom design (until I discovered auto-strut xD) with a big fairing in the middle !

This one is capable of landing 50t.+ on the Mun, it is a variation of my 30t. to Duna which is almost the same.

[@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/) The team here at Andetch X-Labs enjoyed our previous trip to the Dog and Booster so much, we decided we wanted to come again, but get better seats this time...... So we let the high tech team have a go.   

I am pleased to present the Skydart - My most heavily researched and developed <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>. I put a lot of work tweaking this design. It lifts off at under 80 m/s a second, and arrives into <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> with 1,500 m/s of <abbr title="Delta-V">dV</abbr>. There is a docking port equipped model in the late stages of development. The flight video I submit includes watching an eclipse (at 6:52) from The Mun's <abbr title="Sphere of Influence">SOI on a "free return" trajectory" (so atmospheric capture was set up from the initial Mun burn, so I didn't need to use the engine again apart from assisting stabilization once deep into Kerbin's atmosphere) </abbr>and a precision landing back at <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>

(Just wondering, for those with making history, does landing at the desert airstrip also count? The runway there goes North-South making the approach a bit more interesting, and it is higher above sea level giving less time to recover and set up the approach dead stick - but still ample time)

Enjoy the video (no sound track, only ambient KSP sound)

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MNwwjI5qVFA?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2018-06-21T07:11:10Z" title="06/21/2018 07:11  AM" data-short="6 yr">June 21, 2018</time> by Andetch**

Congratulations to ...

[@Loompar](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/189773-loompar/) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with The Challenger (video).

[@Kerbolitto](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/189092-kerbolitto/)  Utilitarial Distinction (Mün), Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Cheval mk4-3.

[@Andetch](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/173643-andetch/)  K﻿osmokerbal Commendation (Mün), Adva﻿nced Pilot Precision Award with Skydart (video).﻿﻿﻿... on completing the K-Prize.

Good luck to Loompar with The Challenger video series, the K-Prize is honoured to be among your chosen missions. 

Successful unorthodoxy is always interesting Kerbolitto, well played.

Welcome back Andetch, the spin redistributing reentry heating did not look entirely accidental, all the R&D at the Dog and Booster evidently paid off!

Thankyou all for your mission reports and welcome (back) to the roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list. 

**Edited <time datetime="2018-06-22T09:32:50Z" title="06/22/2018 09:32  AM" data-short="6 yr">June 22, 2018</time> by boolybooly**

> 
> 
> 2 hours ago, boolybooly said:
> 
> 
> Welcome back Andetch, the spin redistributing reentry heating did not look entirely accidental, all the R&D at the Dog and Booster evidently paid off!
> 

Ya, it was a happy accident - didn't managed to flip the radial out switch off in time before the, but it did turn out that it cut the speed with the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> in just the right place to land - really happy accident seeing as I was on a "free return" so it was pure fluke that the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> was in the right place for landing!! I was expecting to aero-brake into <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> and then set up the landing but, meh, it worked, don't knock it! 

Oh, and I should also point out that even though I didn't on the video, this can carry a small satellite with it. How much does it need to weigh to qualify as payload?

**Edited <time datetime="2018-07-02T08:45:30Z" title="07/02/2018 08:45  AM" data-short="6 yr">July 2, 2018</time> by TheFlyingKerman**

Congratulations to...

[@TheFlyingKerman](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/182407-theflyingkerman/) Utilitarial Commendation, Advanced Pilot Precision Award with HKA-4B.

... on completing the K-Prize mission successfully with a neatly economical and professional looking mission, completing dual satellite launches as well as a safe landing on the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> runway. Thankyou for your mission report and  welcome back to the K-Prize party guest list aka the K-Prize roll of honour. I added your listing beneath the previous entry for HKA-3A btw, as is the K-Prize way.

Here is my entry:

[https://imgur.com/a/6yS1Ywc](https://imgur.com/a/6yS1Ywc)

I think I should be eligible for the advanced pilot precision award.

My X-Wing is <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> capable, and I believe meets all the rules.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hAZ5JSWFM5c?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>
